message.content:
I need to identify the line item that represents the addition in the amount owed by the entity for goods or services received or purchased on credit.

On a cash flow statement, this is typically represented by an increase in Accounts Payable. Accounts Payable represents the money a company owes to its suppliers or vendors for goods or services purchased on credit.

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see the line item:
"Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable" with a value of 7566370.00

This positive number indicates an increase in Accounts Payable, meaning the company has increased what it owes to suppliers during this period. This is the addition in the amount owed by the entity for goods or services received or purchased on credit.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '7566370.00'}}
```
